title: Organization Communication Methods Schema
description: The systems, protocols, and technologies used by the organization to share information internally and coordinate activities across different hierarchical levels and geographical locations.

method.description: The specific communication technique or technology used by members within the organization, such as messenger systems, code languages, or magical/technological means.

security_level.description: The degree of secrecy and security applied to this communication method, determining which members have access to information shared through it.

usage_context.description: When and how this communication method is typically employed, such as for routine updates, emergency situations, or specific types of sensitive information.

internal_communication.description: The various ways in which organization members exchange information among themselves, maintaining operational cohesion and hierarchical control.

public_communications.description: How the organization communicates with the general populace, including propaganda methods, public announcements, or symbolic displays that reinforce its presence.

diplomatic_channels.description: The formal and informal pathways through which the organization communicates with other power structures, negotiates, or shares intelligence with allies and rivals.

external_messaging.description: How the organization projects its message to the outside world, manages its public image, and conducts relations with other entities.

distinctive_practices.description: Unique or signature communication elements that distinguish this organization, such as special greetings, coded messages, or unique information networks that reflect its culture and operational needs.
